title: Chandon NV Rosé Sparkling (California)
description: Foamy, fresh and rather soft, this mouthfilling wine smells subtly like raspberries and cherries. It tastes attractively fruity and has a smooth texture.

title: Domaine Dominique Gruhier 2013 Côte de Grisey  (Bourgogne Epineuil)
description: This wine is ripe and concentrated. It's packed with red fruit while also having solid tannins that give a firm structure. Acidity shoots through at the end to give a fresh lift, although the wine needs to age. Drink from 2017.

title: Chateau Burgozone 2014 Viognier (Danube River Plains)
description: An engaging bouquet of green apple, peach and white flowers brace the palate for flavors of white peach and apricot with a hint of rose petal. This wine is clean in the mouth with an invigorating finish.

title: Allimant-Laugner 2014 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Roses, peaches and apricots all swing in the unctuous richness of this plush Gewurztraminer. They are countered by some freshness but this is certainly on the plumper side. It will be the perfect match for ripe, soft cheeses.

title: Anglim 2012 Cerise Red (Central Coast)
description: Round red fruits, hibiscus and rose petals show brightly on the nose of this blend of 44% Grenache, 43% Mourvèdre, 11% Syrah and 2% Viognier. It's light in body and easy to quaff thanks to vibrant, zinging acidity, with flavors of pepper, more hibiscus and pomegranate.

title: Brecon Estate 2014 Albariño (Central Coast)
description: This is a tight and bright take on the grape with steely kiwi and scratched pomelo aromas. The palate is framed by appealing pome fruit with a touch of juicy lemons and the slightest shred of sweetness.

title: MontGras 2013 Antu Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Prickly aromas of nettle and green herbs are matched by spicy blackberry and lactic oak notes. A tight, tannic palate is firmly built, with spicy flavors of cherry and cassis as well as olive. A peppery, herbal, toasty finish sends this on its way. Drink through 2018.

title: Kuentz-Bas 2013 Collection Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: Rather closed on the nose, this shows plump, sweet pear fruit countered by sprightly, spiky, lemony acidity. This is lively and fruity and easy to drink; enjoy while flavors are at their peak.

title: Kuentz-Bas 2013 Collection Riesling (Alsace)
description: Earthy lemon and tart flavors of freshly cut green apples play on nose and palate. With time on the palate, the lemony freshness dominates and lingers texturally, with a suggestion of apple peel. This has lots of freshness and a dry finish.

title: Parducci 2012 Isabella Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)
description: This is a good, solid wine labeled to commemorate the 80th anniversary of the Parducci estate. It has robust flavors, full body and a rich layer of tannins to add texture. The flavors are like ripe plums and pomegranate juice. It also has good balance and develops an elegant mouth-feel.

title: Stemmler 2013 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: From multiple vineyard sites in the appellation, this wine is a tremendous value, offering vibrancy and complexity in an approachable way. The entry is marked by candied raspberry and strawberry, with hits of cinnamon and earth. Soft and easygoing, it ends in a rustic knot of tight tannin that resolves in the glass.

title: Stephen Vincent 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: The aromas of this full-bodied, dry and sophisticated wine show black olive, light smoke and oak. The palate brings flavors of dark cherries and a touch of dark chocolate, with firm tannins offering a pleasing texture.

title: Raphael Dal Bo NV Extra Dry  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)
description: White spring flower and white peach aromas jump out of the glass and follow through to the vibrant palate along with crisp green apple. A soft mousse lends finesse.

title: Rideau 2014 Estate Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Lightly mauve in color, this rosé blend of 51% Syrah, 21% Grenache and 28% Mourvèdre shows ripe watermelon, bubblegum and strawberry on the juicy nose. The palate is quite restrained for such a ripe nose and deep color, but ripe plums emerge alongside graphite minerality and a pithy grip.

title: Robert Young 2012 Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)
description: Crisp apple and lemon mark this wine, from a legend of Alexander Valley and California Chardonnay. Oaky caramel and toast dominate on the midpalate, before a significant amount of fennel comes into play on the finish.

title: Tolosa 2013 Clonal Select Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: This blended study of 2A, 115, 667 and Pommard clones shows black pepper, red cherry, pressed purple flowers, eucalyptus and a touch of hot asphalt on the nose. The lean and light palate conveys lots of dried herbs and raspberry-cranberry juice, enlivening the tongue with sourness.

title: Santa Ema 2013 Amplus Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Plum and raspberry aromas are herbal and slightly grassy. On the tongue, wiry acidity feels citric. Flavors of red plum, spiced cherry, tomato and herbs ride a road of choppy acidity and rough tannins to a bold finish. Drink through 2020.

title: Santa Ema 2013 Amplus Old Vine Carignan (Maule Valley)
description: This dark, muscular Carignan smells cool and earthy, with a heavy dose of unintegrated oak creating woodgrain and vanilla aromas. This feels full but shows structural gaps, while blackberry, clove and resiny, grainy flavors finish with tannic hardness and lasting woody flavors.

title: Luke 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Wahluke Slope)
description: This is the inaugural release of this Clifton Hill and Clifton Bluff vineyards wine. Aromas of plum, dark berries, pencil lead and chocolate precede soft, plump fruit flavors. It goes down far too easy.

title: Lusso Della Terra 2013 Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Black plums and Mission figs stewed with cinnamon, cloves and vanilla make for an intriguing nose on this bottling from a longtime Italian winemaking family. The palate shows cola, black cherry, coffee bean and dark chocolate, though proves quite grippy with a structure that will let down its guard with patience.

title: Proulx 2014 Willow Creek Farm Rose of Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: A slightly sour red-apple and light strawberry aroma meets with a touch of watermelon and cotton candy on the nose of this blend of 76% Grenache, 10% Syrah, 8% Mission, 4% Zinfandel and 2% Cinsault. There is lots of citrus zing to the nectarine-driven palate, which also shows some pink-lemonade flavors.

title: Quadratus 2011 Pinot Noir (Danube River Plains)
description: The color of slightly faded garnet, this wine has a nose of red and black cherry.The flavor of fresh cherry continues in the mouth, supported by the spicy taste of cinnamon. There is a nice note of brightness on the fruit-filled finish.

title: Emile Beyer 2014 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: Only very subdued notes of citrus emerge and add a little polish to a rounded, balanced and dry palate. However, a lovely, bundled ray of tangerine zestiness at the core brightens the wine immensely.

title: Erzetič 2013 Rebula (Goriska Brda)
description: Known in Italy as Ribolla Gialla, Rebula is the name used for the same grape on the Slovenian side of the border. This wine has aromas of pineapple, tropical fruit and dried lavender. Flavors of green apple and pineapple flourish on the palate, lingering into the surprisingly tart finish.

title: Honig 2012 Bartolucci Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: There is much to enjoy in this vineyard-designate, from grippy tannins to dark, brooding black fruit. Burly, it also tends toward barbecue smoke and cigar, a dense wine of great power and alcohol, aged entirely in new French oak.

title: Kenefick Ranch 2012 Estate Grown Merlot (Calistoga)
description: A mushroomy underbelly lies beneath a layer of leather and graphite, making for a tight, dry wine with sizable tannin structure. Powerfully concentrated, this wine holds 10% Cabernet Sauvignon and is not for the faint of heart.

title: Gracianna 2013 Bacigalupi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is easy to like at first taste, a heady, interesting combination of ripe, rich red fruit and spicy earth, accented in black tea and truffle. Soft in texture, and from a wonderful grower, it may have gotten overly ripe, finishing a touch hot.

title: Fess Parker 2014 Marcella's White (Santa Barbara County)
description: This easy-drinking blend of 86% Viognier, 8% Roussanne, 3% Marsanne and 3% Grenache Blanc—featuring a sailboat painting by Santa Barbara artist Chris Potter—offers aromas of flambéed bananas and toasted coconut on the nose. The palate shows grapefruit pith and the warmth of browned pears and seared red apples, seasoned with a nice sparkle of acidity.

title: Domaine Gérard Neumeyer 2013 les Hospices Riesling (Alsace)
description: Freshly burnt, dark-brown Demerara sugar is a first, intriguing whiff, followed by more conventional notes of yellow plum and fresh lemon. The lemon also dominates the dry, sprightly palate and the moderate finish.

title: Domaine Méo-Camuzet 2013  Fixin
description: Very fresh and fruity, this wine from the north end of the Côte de Nuits has tight acidity and plenty of raspberry fruit, fragrant and perfumed. It should be ready to drink from 2017.
